p:
Park et al. reported that nine alkylated chalcones isolated from Angelica keiskei exhibited different inhibitory activities against SARS-CoV 3CL pro and PL pro based on a cell-free assay. Of the nine chalcones, xanthoangelol E ( 26), containing a perhydroxyl group, showed the most potent 3CL pro and PL pro inhibitory activity (IC 50 = 7.1 and 1.2 Î¼M, respectively). Protein inhibitor analysis showed that chalcones exhibited competitive inhibition of SARS-CoV 3CL pro, while noncompetitive inhibition was evident with SARS-CoV PL pro.
99
